job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: My inpatient unit was technologically advanced compared to other hospitals I worked at. We had iphones, fast log in to computer system with our badge. All the nurses I worked with dressed very professionally wearing nice scrubs and always in dress code. The resources and support system for nurses dealing with critical patients were great. We had IV team, stat nurse who were always very helpful.
cons: My manager in particular started hiring majority of one race. The diversity suffered. Also, the longer I worked there, the farther in advance you had to request PTO. By the time I left, you had to request days off almost 6 months in advance, and the system to do so got more complicated as well.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: The benefits are good. The shift differential was good
cons: The floor I worked at didn't do smart schedule, we were short staff, especially on nights, and have been denied PTO and forced to do coverage

job_title: CNA First Year in Pendleton, OR
pros:
A great way to learn about the hospital environment and what it's like to work directly with patients. Regular CHI education can help teach you how to approach to deescalate a situation with a patient and protect yourself. Remember it's okay to ask for help from your charge nurse and/ or supervisor or other coworkers. This helps everyone get back on track with the plan set out for the day and remember to have respect for one another.
You can get a bonus if you've been there longer than a year.
cons: CNAs scopes will soon be broadening with more duties, but CNAs are not getting a raise for it yet.

job_title: Nurse Tech in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: I work with a great group of people

review_title: The good and bad of St.Anthony's Hospital.
job_title: Patient Transporter in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: The ability to accrue extra shift because the supervisors trust in you. I was able to learn different positions although I wasn't actually applying for a different position. The pay was solid, but for the work that we did on a daily basis, I felt the pay and annual raises could have been much better.
cons: A major issue was certain workers not pulling their weight, which led to heavier work loads for the rest of the employees on certain days. Insurance was very basic, to be kind. I found our treatment by others in the hospital was overlooked by certain managers in our department. Those people had to be replaced to even get certain things done for us, and even that was not much.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Great place to work! Decent benefits and good pay.  Love the people and the culture.
cons:
Not a lot of room for advancement.  No opportunity for new RN's to train in specialty areas.  I have been an LPN for many years at St Anthonys and now with my RN, I'm given very little credit for my experience or opportunity to train of areas of interest. 
They no longer offer bonuses. 
They price of insurance premiums per month have went up.

review_title: Extra pay for weekend evening or overnight
job_title: Hospital Pharmacist in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: There are two 7-on 7-off positions but they are overnight, 8 pm to 7 am. Good people, good company, I enjoy working here
cons: Department does not have any specific memo or policy posted when they make a change in the way they want things done, it is sort of word of mouth and a lot of people do things differently. Very inconsistent between pharmacist to pharmacist in what they are willing to do and what they refuse to do. Leadership here is very new.

review_title: The Staff are good but watch out for Management
job_title: in Denver, CO
pros: The staff who  work there "walk on water." and are generally helpful. Sometimes the limited resources cause some people trouble and then people do not treat each other well.  The management values are a good goal.  The benefits are better than most employers.
cons: In general,  management does not know how or make time to treat people well.  They have core values but the moment a fiscal problem occurs the the values go out the door.   Management pretends to listen to the staff.

review_title: I was a patient care technician and a Sitter for (BA-52)s while attending college for my nursing license.
job_title: PCT/Sitter in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: St. A's is my favorite hospital in St. Petersburg to work for, and I have worked at every hospital in town. They have an excellent benefit package. The employees' are helpful and cooperative.
cons: They mostly hire R.N.s now which is good and bad. I would much rather have a military nurse or LPN with experience over a young kid out of college with only school smarts.

review_title: My experience at St. Anthony’s Hospital in St. Petersburg, Florida
job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: When I worked at St. Anthony’s Hospital in St. Petersburg, Florida, there was a very skilled staff of friendly nurses on my floor.
cons: There were a lot of employees talking behind other employees backs, which was very frustrating and uncomfortable. There seemed to be a lot of turnover as well.

job_title: Staff RN in Michigan City, IN
pros: Salary for area.  Nice physicians.  For the most part, pretty nice people.
cons: very unfair / unequal job responsibilities. No follow through with anything, no ownership by employees.  Patient/ nurse ratio needs desperate re eval in regard to acuity and not number.  Inapprpropriate ER patient floor admission.  Ill knowledge and communication of management/ supervisors.  But very quick to find fault.Dangerous for patients and staff, high infection due to MD following, not care by RNs.

job_title: Clinic Representative in Oklahoma City, OK

review_title: Inner city Catholic Hospital that truly cares for it's patients and the overall community.

review_title: It was a varied experience fo me; sometimes great, sometimes not so great.
